item.description:
Similar in style to the Holy Roman Empire

Main religion is connected to Trea'mor
Ruling house of half-elf / half-kobolds

item.description:
Similar in style to the Ottoman Empire

Worship God in Dalom
Ruled by a house of gnomes

item.title: Fire Brigade
item.description:
An important government entity in Local Region. Responsible for putting out fires and protecting people from the elementals coming down from Mount Bolbotan.


Saboh Layosh - Chief
Merike - firetruck dragon
Anastriella - artificer
Beverly

item.description:
Light
Arcana


Dalom Empire

item.title: Perforus
item.description:
Fire?
Forge?


Temple in Mount Bolbotan volcano.
Often sends fiery beasts out into the world.
Some divine shrimp claimed Perforus was trying to teach the world how to deal with fire because the volcano will soon erupt. Priests don't believe it will.

item.description:
Tempest
Knowledge


Beero Empire


Romero
Sösmöt

item.title: Cursed Stone
item.description:
Appears at first glance to be a sending stone, but is engraved with an infernal rune and apparently cursed. Found by Sösmöt at the Sunken Mausoleum.

Reappears on Sösmöt's person if he lets go of it for any reason.
Gives off infernal / unholy vibes.

item.title: Alfbern
item.description: Largest settlement in the region of Local Region (large village / small town). Not exactly in the geographical center of the region, but stands as the cultural, trade, and religious center of the region, with multiple temples. North of Bolto Lake and connected to the lake by swampy marshes and artificial channels. Located within a basin: surrounded by mountains in the north. Alfbern is the center of the Fire Brigade.

item.title: Bluewell
item.description: There is a library here with a book called "The Big Blue Book of Methods Against Mephits"

item.title: Greysilk Kingdom
item.description:
Kingdom is on the border between the Beero and Dalom empires. It is even more unstable and ungovernable than the surrounding region, thus neither empire has a strong presence here.

Current King is a young halfling.
Some strong magic here


Gnome
Halfling
Elf
Human
Orc
Dwarf

item.title: Headless Vargouille
item.description: The inn in Alfbern run by Amit where Finvelinor and Melinor were staying for a time.

item.title: Mount Bolbotan
item.description: Volcano in Local Region which houses a Temple to Perforus. Bolbrima sits at its foot. Source of many fire elemental creatures which are a danger to the region.

item.title: Phur D'eau
item.description: Town with a good high school where Pishti goes to school.

item.title: Sunken Mausoleum
item.description:
A sunken mausoleum buried in the swamp between Alfbern and Bluewell. Topped by an elven poem of secular origin. Around 100 years old.

This is where we found Sösmöt in Session 2 - Missing Priest.
Romero dived down into the mud to find a locked door with acid bubbling out from the entrance.
Fin senses the grave has infernal / unholy / desecrated vibes.

item.title: Greysilk Kingdom
item.description:
Alfbern is maybe where we're starting? -
center of fire brigade
multiple temples / religious center
Temple for forge god (Perforus) in volcano who often sends fiery beasts out into the world.
Our area is swampy, with lots of reeds, thatch roof houses, very flammable.
Fire brigade is a very important government structure.
Mostly small villages.
Something magically potent.
Country unstable, and this area somehow even more unstable / ungovernable. Not worth it for either Empire to have a permanent presence.
Current King is a young halfling.
Chief of the fire brigade (important NPC with some underlings)




Other notable mixed races - everything is possible from all the big 7
Should we come up with a reason why we're in Alfbern?
Are there any tieflings / aasimar / angels / devils / other outsiders and mixing?
Potential Warlock patron

North of gnome city, southern side of Balto, is where centaurs live. We're going to figure out their genders! "Forming a herd" = marriage. "Register as a herd".

4 genders (cardinal directions?).
Most important is personality traits (like astrology?), and second is bodies (animal type? type of hooves? etc)
Genders:

item.title: Anastriella
item.description:
A half-elven woman who works as an artificer for the Fire Brigade. Loves explosives.

In a relationship with Saboh Layosh and Merike. Had to give up some of her fun with fireworks for Saboh, but still quite excited about them.

item.title: Beverly
item.description: Human member of the Fire Brigade in Alfbern.

item.title: Brother Leywin
item.description: Follower of Trea'mor in Alfbern. Quite shy, and friends with Romero.

item.title: Mattea
item.description: A strong, half-elven woman who works as a ranger in the swamp in Local Region. Wears plain clothing with lots of camouflage and pockets. We met her on our way to Mount Bolbotan with Sösmöt (see Session 3 - Over the river and through the swamp). Owns a sexy little tent (her own clothes transform into a tent around her?).

item.title: Merike
item.description:
Three-headed firetruck dragon
Wears magical harness that gives zir magical wings to provide flight.
In a relationship with Saboh Layosh and Anastriella

item.title: Pishti
item.description: A drake. Child of Merike, Saboh Layosh, and Anastriella. Goes to school in Phur D'eau.

item.title: Roy Earthdweller
item.description: Dwarf and local wheelmaker in Alfbern. Married to Anya (see Session 1 - Wedding Woes)

item.title: Saboh Layosh
item.description:
Several-hundred-year-old, dark-skinned dwarven man
Chief of the Fire Brigade in Alfbern
In a relationship with Merike and Anastriella

item.title: Sister Graelea
item.description: A firbolg priestess with a strong build. Her religion is basically 'vibes'. She performed the ceremony marrying Roy Earthdweller and Anya in Alfbern, then invited Finvelinor to her home following the reception.

item.title: Sister Marygold
item.description: Follower of Trea'mor in Alfbern

item.title: Sösmöt
item.description:
Silver Dragonborn
Romero's mentor
Very far removed relative of Merike the firetruck dragon.

item.title: Finvelinor
item.description:
Appears as a tall, young, lithe elven man with long braided auburn hair and bright amber eyes. His clothing is often rich and saturated with many natural hues, especially greens. He is typically very friendly, with a warm smile on his face and a kind word even for a stranger.


Sister Graelea
Mattea

item.title: Melinor
item.description:
Elven scout (Rogue) from the Royal Guard, left in disgrace?
Possibly Finvelinor's closest friend, as Finvelinor once saved his life and they have been traveling together since
Quiet, reserved, perhaps even tortured
Keeps an old knife which he never uses
told Fin it was a gift from someone important and is meant to keep him safe
has wooden hilt with 'M' carved in one side and 'E' on the other.
has apparent sentimental value

item.title: Romero
item.description:
Reborn Cleric of Trea'mor
Curly black hair and a beard
As a returned undead, he does not need to eat, drink, or sleep, requires very little rest, and is less affected by poisons. However, he also feels very little emotion.
Missing most of his memories
Earliest memory is of suddenly being conscious in the tower of a necromantic wizard from which he immediately ran away
Studies under his mentor, Sösmöt

item.title: Session 1 - Wedding Woes
item.description:
#Palinka

"The Duke" of Gnome city
And a Royal Family (can't hold title of city leader) with guards, which is what Melinor was part of.

We find ourselves on an Autumn day in Alfbern, a city we already know!

Arrived last night/afternoon at the Headless Vargouille Inn.
Monastery of Trea'mor in Alfbern, with 5 monks living there.
Amit is the half-elven innkeeper, having a fight outside with a dwarven man (something about barrels?), Roy Earthdweller, the local wheel-maker.
Roy says Amit has always been respectable, but Roy is getting married, his family is throwing a party and they need "the good stuff". But 2 barrels of #Palinka (strong spirit) went missing.
There were guards watching the carts the barrels were loaded onto but they claim not to have seen anything
Finvelinor and Melinor both may have heard the sounds of rumbling (rolling of barrels), possibly another cart moving around, the preceding evening.
Courtyard is rectangular with cobblestones. Frequently used, not often repaired.
2 carts closer to Roy's house
1 human guard from fire brigade. She sits on a stone near the wagons.
She claims to still be waking up (whoops!) and complains about the bright light. No sign of hangover, but she seems severely exhausted, more than what one should be after a night of drinking or guarding or whatever.
Says the chief of the fire brigade is super busy, but everything got very busy 5 days ago? But the chief hasn't explained why. He started going on longer expeditions, often outside of the city taking care of who knows what. Thought the chief was dealing with the situation with Merike as usual, but ze has to sleep a lot (because ancient), and whenever we use zir help it has to be managed as a limited resource. Ze sleeps in town but also in a cave a day's walk away in the mountains.
Finvelinor checks Beverly for signs of being drugged. Romero looks around for signs of magic, like sleeping spells, and Melinor investigates the area for tracks.
Romero senses a kind of divine energy present, vibes of if you cooked soup several hours ago and could still smell it in the area.
Finvelinor tries divine sense and "smells" it's strongest where the barrels were and can follow the traces (wispy cartoon smell) to a gap in the stone fence of the courtyard, to a field and forest by the time the ability ends.
Continuing forward we see light and smell smoke/fire in what is probably a clearing.


Romero runs to put out the fire with his blanket
Finvelinor senses a divine force pushing the barrels and calls out to the others
Melinor runs to tackle a barrel but misses
One of the barrels spits acid? at Fin, but misses, the other sprays flaming alcohol which Fin takes right to the face.
Romero rolls over some fire to put it out
Finvelinor puts out his own fire then lasso's one of the barrels and tries to speak to it gently to calm it down. Hears gurgling in response.
Melinor tries to lasso his own but misses.
Romero speaks down to them like children to make them stop playing but it has no effect.
Barrel breaks free from Fin
Finvelinor commands one of the barrels to freeze and runs and grabs the rope still attached to the other.
Melinor manages to remove the top of one barrel and finds a glowing shrimp creature swimming around inside.
Finvelinor's barrel spits a line of burning alcohol, Melinor saves but Fin takes another face full of fire and falls prone again with only 3 HP remaining.
Romero tries to get the shrimp out of the barrel but misses. It laughs at him.
Finvelinor gets the flames off himself and moves to the other side of the barrel, then heals himself by laying on hands.
Melinor manages to fish the shrimp out of his barrel, which exclaims "Fuck" in celestial (only Romero understands).
The other barrel sprays fire and this barrel catches fire. But Romero tries to put it out. Fails, but threatens the shrimp with putting it in his alms box. The shrimp claims to just be doing what it's told, that we don't know how to deal with fire and that it's teaching us?
Finvelinor tries to command and intimidate the second shrimp but to no avail.
A dark-skinned dwarven man arrives with a barrel backpack complaining about the fire. Fires his hose and sprays the barrel and Melinor. This knocks over the barrel which isn't perfectly sealed, and it begins leaking.
Melinor rights the barrel and runs the shrimp away.
Romero heals Mel with a word, jumps over some fire and tries to pry the lid of the other barrel off with a dagger but doesn't quite manage (lowers the DC)
Finvelinor gets the lid off and snatches the shrimp out, then runs over to the rocks.
The dwarf sprays the fire but gets knocked down by the force and doesn't get it all.
Melinor tries to cut off the shrimp's head with his dagger but can't get through the carapace.
The shrimps try to spit acid on us but both fail.
Romero rolls the fire out.
Finvelinor slices partway through but doesn't manage to kill it.
Dwarf grumbles about newbies who care more about wine than protecting the community and we tell him off.
Melinor finally manages to sneak attack, then throws a knife and hits Fin's.


Romero explains to us that one of the shrimps mentioned they were "training" us to handle fire, on the orders of their "boss".
This dwarf is the chief of the fire brigade😱.
Says Divination wizards claim the volcano is extinct and won't erupt again, but Perforus is telling his followers to get ready for when it erupts again. God is trying to get the whole region ready, not just his followers, by sending fire elementals and little tricky shrimp like this. (Says Perforus is a nice guy, in the fairy tales and myths, but kinda hard to deal with like this 😅)
Gives us one vial of ointment each for treating burns - 1d12+3 healing from fire damage.
IS THE SUN A GIANT FLAMING EGG WITH A CREATURE GROWING INSIDE?


Arrive at wedding before ceremony. Melinor sneaks almost unnaturally well into the wedding.
Officiated by a firbolg woman (Sister Graelea) with strong build and long flowy blue dress. Religion is basically 'vibes' 😅
Adorning bride (Anya) with blue flowers (like blue bells and tiny not-violets). Becomes flower shoulder-pads.
Roy carried out on his brothers' arms making a chair.
Anya kneeling on one knee.
Roy leaps from the seat, runs and leaps into Anya's arms who holds him up in the air like a dance lift. Anya not a super strong woman but obviously been practicing.
Lowers him down, they embrace.
Sister Graelea takes one of the flowers from the shoulder pads and unwinds them, re-winding them around the couple.
Then the couple teleports away and Sister Graelea gives a speech about them making their "first connection" as a married couple, that it's a conversation. (We all know she means sex 😉)
Party begins. Dinner without the couple. Then dancing, with a dance in a circle with the close family, then at the height the couple reappears in different outfits.
Roy comes and talks to us while Anya is dancing with her sisters and thanks us for getting the wine.
Finvelinor chats up Sister Graelea, they dance for a while and she "invites him back to her shrine" 🍆💦
Melinor distances himself from the festivities a bit and
Romero sits by himself contemplatively, looking a bit unhappy. Brother Leywin (high elf) joins him. Romero opens up about his feelings, not knowing what he still doesn't have or what it could have felt like, what he lost. Brother Leywin thinks it's already beautiful that Trea'mor brought him back.
Romero's mentor left for volcano, trying to work out holy water logistics due to vampire problem.
Finvelinor and Romero find Melinor sitting staring at an old knife he never uses for anything. Has told Fin it was a gift from someone important and it's meant to keep him safe. Wooden hilt with an M carved in one side and an E on the other side.
Saboh comes in at the moment Romero is trying to light straw on fire and tells him off. But Romero convinces him to let them take a key to the fire brigade practice room to mess around with fire. Needless to say they're quite drunk at this point...
Mel tries to drunkenly add a flower to Anya's hair but she catches him. When he explains how pretty she looks and he just wanted to add a flower, she asks him to put it in her hair. Anya expresses her gratitude for bringing back the Palinka — her sisters were unsure about Roy.
Mel and Rom experiment the rest of the night lighting different qualities of Palinka on fire...

item.title: Session 2 - Missing Priest
item.description:
Waking up the next morning after the wedding. Romero fails his Con save about getting drunk, he's the only one of us who's hungover somehow.
Romero goes to church, but the whole town was at the wedding last night so no one is there 😅.
He asks permission to follow his mentor to the volcano from Sister Marygold. She doesn't have the authority, but has a sending stone to ask Sösmöt.
"Mount Bolbotan" is the name of the volcano.
Sösmöt isn't answering the phone! Sister Marygold asks him to make a post on the village Quest Board to ask for extra support to see if he's ok.
Sister Graelea provides Finvelinor with jam and brioche for breakfast, but has to take a sacred day of rest after the wedding. Fin arrives to meet Mel and Rom around 8 am in a particularly good mood.
Romero expresses his concerns for his mentor and the other two agree to look into his disappearance.


3 hours in we find dragonborn footprints off the side of the road. Romero and Mel spot the sending stone under a tree trunk. The footprints disappear.
On the tree trunk is a pool of glittery green water which Fin dips his finger in and burns himself on acid.
Fin divinely senses that the puddle gives off undead vibes and seems to have been left there deliberately.
As Mel is looking at the mud, it begins to move a bit. In the moving mud he also finds an insignia of Romero's church! GASP


The mud creature gets up and flies further into the swamp as Romero attempts to grapple with it. It gurgles as it flies. Some kind of language? Screaming something into the swamp.
Creature has wings, little head, long arms. Looks a bit skeletal, like the way the mud is dripping it doesn't quite have a solid body.
Fin runs up and grabs the insignia off the ground, hits the creature with an arrow. It hisses and looks back at him angrily.
Another stirs next to Fin's feet and spits mud at him but misses.
We hear a moan from deeper in the swamp
Can see a bit further away some manmade stone
Fin runs toward a draconic claw in the swamp, hears a voice saying "oh no, I didn't think this would happen to me".
Romero distracts one of the creatures (gray) from attacking Fin. It doubles back towards him.
Melinor manages to crit sneak attack one of the creatures next to Romero. It blows apart in a sticky, muddy explosion and dissolves into the ground.
Rom smacks the other one next to him with his mace.
The mud creatures are pretty bad at attacking and have missed everything so far.
When Fin arrives at the dragonborn, narrowly dodges spit from the creature which turns out to be on him. But then is hit by more acid thrown from behind the stone (appears to be same acid as from the tree stump).
Melinor spots a skeleton holding a jug of green liquid behind the stone.
Fin smites the creature on Sösmöt, hitting it with both swords, and is lucky enough that the explosion dissipates away from both him and Sossy.
The skeleton fires acid at Melinor and manages to crit him once.
Fin covers Sossy as he starts moving back to the shore of the swamp.
Mel manages to shoot the skeleton, spinning its head around once
Fin heals Sossy, who is very thankful.
Skeleton gets frustrated and leaps out from behind the gravestone. Runs after Fin and Sossy.
Sossy offers Fin help with spells and stuff in thanks for saving his life.
Mel fires another arrow at the skeleton, breaking the acid jar and melting one of its hands off
The skeleton manages to catch up to Fin and Sossy, but Fin stabs it through the skull with his rapier. Though perhaps just being a Paladin was enough to scare it "to death"
As Romero kills the last mud creature, it hugs him and covers him in restrictive goo.
Fin magically prestidigitates him clean.


Sossy says he normally just deals with fire elemental creatures on the journey, so he thought he would be ok.
Says the old grave belonged to a noble family (part of a now Sunken Mausoleum) from 100s of years ago. Died from a plague?
Says the undead presence here could be related to the vampires he was going to help take care of.
He joins us to inspect the grave
Elven writing (poem) on the grave stone. Written by secular elves, not connected to any religion or god. Strange not to have some mention of the divine on a grave, even among a group like this. Grave seems about ~100 years old
Grooves on the corners of the obelisk at intervals that are good for climbing. Traces of acid on these grooves.
Romero decides to go for a dive in the mud to try to gather more info. Manages to feel the entrance door to the mausoleum... but that's about it.
Then! Romero casts create water to allow himself to descend further. Feels a lock. Sticks his hand back up and Mel messages to ask what for, he asks for thieves tools and tries to open it but fails. Does however notice a bubble of acid escaping from the lock after trying the thieves tools on the stone door.
Sossy says there's an artificer working for the Fire Brigade (partner of the fire chief) who loves explosives/explosions, and she might be willing to help us off the record
He also uses another sending stone (with a bad-looking rune on it) to call the high priestess. (Anastriella is their artificer).
He throws the stone away when it "won't send" and it poofs away when it hits the ground. When we ask about it, he pulls it out of his pocket again and says Anastriella is a bit crazy.
Fin gets the strong impression that some magical effect is barring him from realizing what happened
Rom recognizes the rune as infernal but can't read it without doing some extra research.
Sossy thinks its his sending stone until we show him his real sending stone.
Divine sense: stone is for sure infernal and cursed. The grave as well has infernal / unholy / desecrated vibes
Sossy probably found the cursed stone in the pool of acid in the tree stump. Jumped for joy upon finding it, and felt like the stone gave him a boon to move graciously through the air... before everything went to shit.
Romero suggests it might be a magical device for spying on us.
Sös says he was headed out to make holy water with the other priests to defend against vampires. (Used up today's use of sending stone to tell friends about a cute butterfly).
We take a short rest and continue onward together

item.title: Session 3 - Over the river and through the swamp
item.description:
Spring nearby to get clean water (source in Bluewell)
Sös sings us a song of rest and shares his specially prepared Kuo-Toa sushi with the rest of us
(Apparently those divine shrimp can be found at the volcano, so maybe we can actually try eating them!). Sushi place in Alfbern has "vegan fireshrimp" and the taste is similar. Cleric of Perforus who wanted to work at a sushi place in Alfbern making real divine shrimp but Saboh Layosh objected.
Saboh and Merike even have children together :) (Magic) (One of their children goes to high school in Phur D'eau)
Merike is not a divinity, but has powerful connection to other planes, powerful being. Ze is Saboh Layosh's warlock patron. Zir children, with Saboh Layosh and Anastriella are more from magic than having been physically carried in one of their bodies.
Child in Phur D'eau (Pishti) is a drake. Have other children as well.
Pseudodragons sometimes born from Merike's sneezes. Which children are actually zirs is more related to intention.
Now that we've finished sating Melinor's curiosity about the birds and the bees and the dragons, we can head to Bolbrima at the foot of the Volcano (and have some divine shrimp 😅)
Sösmöt thinks, with the news that Merike hasn't been seen for a while, that we should travel with more urgency to Bolbrima. And we should signal a swamp ranger in Bluewell to take us by boat.


Beautiful early autumn day. See a half-elven woman dressed in clean, plain clothes, on a plain gondola-like boat. Fish in the bed of the boat and shrimp pots dangling over the sides. Smiles at us and greets Sösmöt. Her name is Mattea and she is a swamp ranger.
Mattea explains that on the way to Bolbrima we can fish some silvered weapons out of the lake. Also checks on Sösmöt.
Turns out we fought mud mephits this morning.
Mattea navigates swamp very expertly and swiftly. Sösmöt uses his dragonborn water-based breath weapon to give a short motor-boat-like boost to our speed.
Arrive at the end of the day at a beautiful little island where we can take a long rest and watch the beautiful sunset over the lake. Can see a lighthouse on the other side. The sun sets in the west.
Sösmöt is looking out at the sunset and praying, holding a book with the symbol of Trea'mor.
"Fin get his spells back from sleeping with strangers". Gives new meaning to the expression "dry spell"
Romero has a memory: Romero's memory The memory is of his sister getting hurt. Remembers rushing towards her wanting to help her, having the feeling of not being able to help her, and doesn't remember what happened next. Was she healed? Did she die? She was severely injured, a big gash on her left side affecting her intestines. But he can't picture her. Didn't even remember he had a sister, now he doesn't know if she's dead and gone or not.
Romero freaks out a little bit about the memory. Fin tries to use Command to get him to Relax, but fails and regrets his actions. Sösmöt gently and consensually uses detect thoughts to explore the memory with Romero
Romero sees a slashing weapon, kind of natural material, possibly stone? Remember his mother, crying... (or aunt?). A woman smaller than he, older sister? Sösmöt manages to see the face. A sister around 9 or 10, Romero was younger at the time (7-8).
Melinor and Romero play dice to help distract him from his painful memories.
Mattea pitches a sexy little tent to protect from the elements. Fin joins her I think? (Her clothes ARE the tent?? Camo, lots of pockets)
In the morning, a bit before dawn, we hear the mooing of cows. Mattea explains that cows sometimes wander into the swamp. A big predatory bird eats these cows, and deer and stuff, so we should be careful. Look stork-like. The sound is often made by the bird to attract cows.
Melinor thinks he sees a tree, but it starts moving, like the long neck of a giant bird. We see 3 of them??
Also see 2 hippogriffs flying towards us. Fin isn't sure if they're coming towards us or the birds (botyabalta).
We fail a group stealth check and the birds see us... :/


Bird (mouth big enough to swallow a whole cow) tries to bite Melinor but misses.
Romero blesses Melinor, Fin, Sosmot, and Mattea
One hippogriff hits the other and flies away, taking an AoO. They're both wounded.
One of the birds bites Romero and he loses concentration and is grappled
Melinor notices the bird eating Romero doesn't seem to be really trying to eat him in the normal way, just grappling him.
Fin smites the bird grappling Romero with his rapier, dealing 24 damage (more than double its HP) and realizes these creatures are undead.
Melinor sneak attacks the other nearby bird and manages to take it down. Then hides in a bush (20).
Sösmöt uses his bardic abilities to inspire Romero, then casts Aid
Mattea fires an arrow at the Vampire HGs attacking Sosmot and kills it.
The 3rd bird sees Melinor hiding and bites him but doesn't manage to grapple him
Two hippogriffs flank Fin, one manages to bite and grapple him, the other misses completely.
Romero summons a spiritual weapon to hit the HG grappling Fin, then casts Turn Undead
Other HG attacks the VHG grappling Fin but misses
Fin "Fin"ishes off the HG grappling him with a smite, and stabs the second next to him.
Melinor steadies his aim and stabs a Bo nearly killing it.
Sösmöt gives Fin inspiration, bites a piece of garlic and uses his cold garlic breath on the remaining VHG
Mattea tries to stab the Bo but misses terribly.
VHG bites Sosmot and he manages to dance out of its grappling claws
Romero hits the VHG with his spirit weapon and a shot from his crossbow
Finvelinor kills the last VHG and tries to hit the last Bo but misses.
Melinor kills the last Bo with a critical hit.


With Mattea's help, Finvelinor manages to approach the wounded hippogriff and put his hands on it, healing it for 5 HP. It cries a tear and nuzzles his hands.
Romero's name becomes Sir Rots-a-lot.
Finvelinor can see that the non-vampire HG has a half-healed gash/scar from a slashing weapon. The VHGs also have scars which killed them, and they were likely brought back as vampires.
Can see these animals were all trying to grapple us and then bite us to drain our life force.
We hear a rustling in the bushes, a snort, and arriving at the clearing we see a humanoid-boar, which suddenly stands up on its hind legs and transforms into a Harangon with tusks and coarser fur and says "Hmph."

item.title: Objectives
item.description:
Return to the Sunken Mausoleum with Anastriella and/or explosives to explore inside
Investigate the origin and purpose of the Cursed Stone
Acquire silvered weapons from Bolto Lake
Investigate the vampire problem around Bolbrima
Get Sösmöt safely to Bolbrima


Find out whether his sister still lives? Or at least what happened to her?

item.title: README
item.description: This repository holds Anthony's notes for Sascha's campaign.
